frame.name: Scrutiny
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame concerns a <fen>Cognizer</fen> (a person or other intelligent being) paying close attention to something, the <fen>Ground</fen>, in order to discover and note its salient characteristics. The <fen>Cognizer</fen> may be interested in a particular characteristic or entity, the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>, that belongs to the <fen>Ground</fen> or is contained in the <fen>Ground</fen> (or to ensure that such a property of entity is not present). Some words in this frame allow alternate expressions of the <fen>Ground</fen>and the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>: <ex>We <t>searched</t> <fex name="Ground">the yard</fex> <fex name="Phen"> for my contact lens</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The FE is normally expressed as an External Argument: <ex><fex name="Cognizer">Leslie</fex> <t>examined</t> the glass for cracks.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Ground
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to the <fen>Ground</fen>, so named because it serves as the background or context for the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>. This FE can be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement. <ex>Leslie <t>examined</t> <fex name="Ground">the glass</fex> for cracks.</ex> <ex>Kim <t>searched</t> <fex name="Ground">the woods</fex> for mushrooms.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Phenomenon
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Phenomenon</fen> identifies the property that belongs to an entity or that the entity contains. Typically, it is expressed as a <ment>for</ment>-PP. <ex>Leslie <t>examined</t> the glass <fex name="Phenomenon">for cracks</fex>.</ex> <ex>Kim <t>searched</t> the woods <fex name="Phenomenon">for mushrooms</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> scrutinizes the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is used for the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to scrutinize the <fen>Ground</fen>. <ex>We <t>analysed</t> the sediment <fex name="Mns">by putting it through the mass spec</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> scrutinizes the <fen>Ground</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Direction</fen> is used for all path-like expressions, except those indicating the location of the perceiver, that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception. <ex>The detective <t>looked</t> <fex name="Direction">across the street</fex> at the suspect.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>Some of the words in this frame occur with a constituent that expresses the desired outcome of the Scrutiny. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment> or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement.
<ex>You should <t>inspect</t> your mail <fex name="Purp">to determine the outcome of the module transfer</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> pays attention to an entity in order to discover something about it. The FE is normally expressed as an External Argument: <ex><fex name="Medium">Chapter four</fex> <t>examined</t> the case for free speech.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity directed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> that interacts with the <fen>Ground</fen> to accomplish the scrutiny.
<ex>The temperature controller <t>monitored</t> the temperature <fex name="ins">with a calibrated silicon diode</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: analyse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: examine methodically and in detail the constitution or structure of.

lexUnit.name: analysis.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a detailed examination of the elements or structure of something.

lexUnit.name: investigate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: carry out a systematic or formal inquiry into (an incident or allegation) so as to establish the truth.

lexUnit.name: investigation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an act of carrying out a systematic or formal inquiry into (an incident or allegation) so as to establish the truth.

lexUnit.name: look.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attempt to find.

lexUnit.name: perusal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of perusing.

lexUnit.name: peruse.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: read or examine thoroughly or carefully.

lexUnit.name: scan.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look at quickly in order to identify relevant features or information.

lexUnit.name: scrutinize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: examine or inspect closely and thoroughly.

lexUnit.name: scrutiny.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: critical observation or examination.

lexUnit.name: search.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of searching.

lexUnit.name: search.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: try to find something by looking or otherwise seeking carefully and thoroughly.

lexUnit.name: study.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a detailed investigation and analysis of a subject or situation.

lexUnit.name: study.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look at closely in order to observe or read.

lexUnit.name: survey.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an act of surveying.

lexUnit.name: survey.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look carefully and thoroughly at.

lexUnit.name: analyst.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who conducts analysis

lexUnit.name: probe.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: physically explore or examine.

lexUnit.name: reconnoitre.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a military observation of (a region).

lexUnit.name: inspector.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an official who ensures that regulations are obeyed.

lexUnit.name: assay.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: perform an analysis (e.g. of an ore or a drug) to ascertain the presence, absence, or quantity of certain components

lexUnit.name: skim.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: read (something) quickly, noting only the important points.

lexUnit.name: sift.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: examine thoroughly so as to isolate that which is important or useful.

lexUnit.name: rummage.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: search unsystematically and untidily for something.

lexUnit.name: surveyor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who surveys land, buildings, etc. as a profession.

lexUnit.name: scout.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a detailed search of a place.

lexUnit.name: eyeball.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stare at closely.

lexUnit.name: check.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to pay attention to something in order to note its feautures

lexUnit.name: sweep.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: search or survey (an area) for something

lexUnit.name: sweep.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an act of searching a place for something

lexUnit.name: double-check.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: check again

lexUnit.name: spy out the land.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to secretely watch a place from hostile motives

lexUnit.name: once-over.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rapid inspection, search, or piece of work.

lexUnit.name: comb.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: search carefully and systematically.

lexUnit.name: frisk.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pass the hands over (someone) in a search for hidden weapons or drugs.

lexUnit.name: ransack.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: thoroughly search.

lexUnit.name: scour.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: subject to a thorough search

lexUnit.name: monitor.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: observe and check over a period of time.

lexUnit.name: analytic.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: used for or pertaining to analysis.

lexUnit.name: go [through].v
lexUnit.definition: COD: search through or examine carefully.

lexUnit.name: monitoring.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of observing and checking over a period of time.

lexUnit.name: unmonitored.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not being monitored.

lexUnit.name: surveillance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: close observation, especially of a suspected spy or criminal.

lexUnit.name: surveillance [entity].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: tools or equipment that allow surveillance.

lexUnit.name: explore.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: travel or look into an area in order to understand it

lexUnit.name: rifle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: go through, alert to the possibility of an item of interest.

lexUnit.name: pry.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: intrude into another's private affairs by searching ininvited

lexUnit.name: examination.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of conducting an inspection of an area

lexUnit.name: reconnaissance.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a preliminary surveillance
